definitions: To equip (a ship or mast) with sails and rigging.
To set up (a device or structure), typically in a makeshift or hasty way.
To manipulate or control (an election, a game, etc.) fraudulently or unfairly.
examples: They will rig the boat for the race.
He had to rig up a temporary shelter.
Accusations were made that they tried to rig the election.
